channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Target Still Has One Item Way Cheaper Than Walmart---Its Stock
item.description: The retailer’s return to comparable-sales growth and margin recovery are early but encouraging signs of a turnaround.

item.title: T.J. Maxx owner raises full-year guidance, posts 5.6% sales gain for the most recent quarter
item.description: TJX Cos. has taken market share from competitors like Macy's and Target as price-sensitive consumers look for a deal amid persistent inflation.

item.title: Luxury Brands Have a Strict Hierarchy. Burberry Found Out the Hard Way.
item.description: The British label’s seven-year push to attract wealthier shoppers has failed and left it with a threadbare share price.

item.title: Target shares spike as profits rise, despite cautious sales outlook
item.description: The discounter's sales rose as shoppers made more visits to Target's stores and website.

item.title: Schwab Wants to Fix Its Struggling Bank. Investors Are Skeptical.
item.description: The brokerage’s playbook of making easy money on customer deposits was upended when interest rates rose rapidly. Now, it is looking to change how it u...

item.title: Macy’s cuts sales forecast as department stores struggle to draw shoppers
item.description: Macy's beat quarterly earnings expectations but it cut its sales forecast for the full year.

item.title: Texas Instruments Tries to Ease Its Capital Pain
item.description: The chip maker says it might moderate capital spending in 2026 amid activist pressure, but new cash flow targets also hinge on revenue pulling out of ...

item.title: Alibaba earnings miss expectations despite cloud acceleration
item.description: Alibaba continues to face headwinds in its core e-commerce business amid rising competition and a cautious Chinese consumer.

item.title: As Generation X Approaches Retirement, Reality Still Bites
item.description: The ‘forgotten generation,’ born between 1965 and 1980, launched their careers at the start of a massive shift in how Americans work.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks extends recent stock rally on solid earnings. It may be too much, too fast
item.description: The roughly 27% rally since Aug. 5 brings the stock just a few dollars shy of its record-high close of nearly $377 on Feb. 9.
